channel.title: news on Daniele Antonioli
channel.description: Recent content in news on Daniele Antonioli

item.title: Academic day_night and search
item.description: Recently gcushen updated Academic (the theme that I’m using to build this website with hugo) with two useful features that I recommend to use: day_night and search. day_night allows the reader to toggle light and dark color themes for the website. If you look at the top navigation bar on the right you should spot an icon with either a moon (to switch to a dark theme) or a sun (to switch to a light theme).

item.title: Our Paper is Accepted for NDSS 2019
item.description: I’m very happy to announce that our paper titled Nearby Threats: Reversing‚Äö Analyzing‚Äö and Attacking Google’s “Nearby Connections” on Android has been accepted for the The Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS). Here you can download a pre-print. Here is the list of accepted papers for NDSS 2019 Soon I’ll update more material such an exploit PoC code. Congratulations to Kasper and Nils and thank you for the help.

item.title: Visiting Researcher at CISPA, University of Saarbr√ºcken
item.description: As part of my PhD I’ve recently joined as a visiting researcher the CISPA ‚Äì Helmholtz-Zentrum, Saarbruecken üá©üá™. I’m going to spend six months there, supervised by Prof. N.O. Tippenhauer.

item.title: Visiting Researcher at the University of Oxford
item.description: As part of my PhD I’ve recently joined as a visiting researcher the Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford üá¨üáß. I’m going to spend around six months there, supervised by Prof. Kasper Rasmussen and co-supervised by Prof. Ivan Martinovic. I’m very excited!

item.title: SAC 2018
item.description: I’m happy to announce that our paper titled State-Aware Anomaly Detection for Industrial Control Systems has been accepted for the Symposium On Applied Computing (SAC) 2018 conference. Congratulations to Hamid, and the co-authors!

item.title: CANS 2017
item.description: This week I’ve been in Hong Kong for the Cryptology And Network Security Conference (CANS) 2017 conference. I’ve presented our paper about: Practical Evaluation of Passive COTS Eavesdropping in 802.11b/n/ac WLAN. Here I’m sharing some pictures with some new friends:

item.title: Institutional Email Issue
item.description: For some reasons my name_surname@sutd.edu.sg email address was deactivated without notice sometime at the end of October 2017. Unfortunately I’ve discovered it only this week and I’m still trying to reactivate it. I apologize if you recently got an error message while trying to send me an email to that address. Please use the surname.name@gmail.com address instead. I ‚ù§Ô∏è ‚úâÔ∏è

item.title: ST Electronics Poster Award at FIRST Industry Workshop 2017
item.description: I’m happy to announce that my poster titled Towards high-interaction virtual ICS honeypots-in-a-box won the ST Electronics Poster Award at the FIRST industry workshop, held at SUTD. This is a special gift one day before my 30th birthday! Here I’m sharing a picture from the award ceremony: Congratulations also to Hamid who won one award: and Eyasu who managed to win two awards:

item.title: Future of Science, Technology and Policy Workshop
item.description: Recently I was selected as a mentor for the cybersecurity track of the Future of Science, Technology and Policy Workshop, organized by SMART. I had the privilege to supervision six graduate and post-graduate colleagues with different backgrounds: Jukka Isoh√§t√§l√§ from NUS (Physics and CS) Nikhil Mallareddy from MIT (Environmental Engineering) Ioannis Fousekis from ETH (EECS and Economics) Michael Wicki from ETH (Political sciences and Economics) Fabian Willibaldf rom ETH (Environmental Engineering) Jay Prakash from SUTD (EECS) I’m presenting the summary of our activities of day 2 related to cybersecurity organized at my institution SUTD:
